technical.focal_length: 35mm and 50mm most common, with 28mm and 85mm also popular; wide-angle for environmental context, normal for natural perspective
technical.depth_of_field: Variable - often moderate to deep (f/5.6-f/11) for zone focusing and sharp backgrounds, occasionally shallow for subject isolation
technical.shutter_speed: Fast enough to freeze motion (1/125s-1/500s), sometimes slower for intentional blur or panning effects
technical.lighting: Available light preferred - natural daylight, artificial street lighting, neon signs, window light; minimal or no flash to maintain candidness
technical.camera_format: 35mm film historically dominant, now full-frame and APS-C digital; rangefinders and compact cameras favored for discretion

aesthetic.composition: Rule of thirds, leading lines, framing within frames, layered compositions, geometric patterns, decisive moment timing
aesthetic.subject_background: Background integral to storytelling - urban architecture, signage, crowds provide context and narrative depth
aesthetic.tonal_range: High contrast often preferred, deep blacks and bright whites, though can vary from high-key to low-key depending on mood
aesthetic.color_approach: Both B&W and color - B&W for timeless quality and focus on form/light, color for contemporary urban vibrancy and cultural documentation
aesthetic.texture_detail: Sharp detail throughout scene typical, capturing urban textures - concrete, metal, glass, fabric, weathered surfaces

shooting_approach.subject_distance: Varies widely - close for intimate human moments, medium for interaction with environment, distant for environmental context
shooting_approach.angle_perspective: Eye-level most common for natural perspective, low angles for drama, high angles for overview of urban scenes
shooting_approach.subject_relationship: Predominantly candid and unposed, subjects often unaware of photographer, capturing authentic human behavior
shooting_approach.environment: Urban streets, public spaces, markets, transportation hubs, sidewalks - anywhere public life unfolds naturally

context.historical_context: Emerged in 1920s-1930s with portable cameras, peaked mid-20th century with Leica cameras and masters like Cartier-Bresson, Evans, Frank
context.key_characteristics: Captures unposed moments of everyday urban life, emphasizes human condition, social commentary, and spontaneous interactions in public spaces
context.related_styles: Documentary photography, photojournalism, urban photography, candid photography, social realism

era_variants.notes: 1920s-40s focused on formal composition and decisive moment; 1950s-60s became more intimate and subjective; digital era brought continuous shooting and immediate review capabilities
